channel.title: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!
channel.description:
Hi moparscape,
today ill be telling you how to make a .bat file work on a 64 bit computer
1. go to your client and open it up 2. go to run.bat and right click it then click edit 3. then were start javaw change it to "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe" LIKE SO [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/16c14p3.png[/img] 4. Save it and it should work for all of the client's (well almost)
If you need a video here you go: [url=http://adf.ly/b18P]http://adf.ly/b18P[/url]

item.title: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

[quote=“CerealKiller, post:3, topic:383935”][quote author=kicker862 link=topic=479694.msg3512621#msg3512621 date=1298700328]
Didnt work.
“Cannot find the path specified.”
[/quote]are you sure your 64 bit? lol couse it should work.[/quote]

Isnt there only a 64 bit version of windows 7? lol

Read full topic
item.source: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!

item.title: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!
item.dc:creator: @i_fail_serv i fail serv
item.description:
@i_fail_serv wrote:

you are sure you using jre6?

try this [if you have latest version JDK if you don’t have latest version jdk download www.java.sun.com]

@echo off
TITLE Run
cd Client Files
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\java.exe” -cp .;theme.jar Gui
pause

2nd idea. try withnout (x86) some 64 bites don’t have the (x86)

Read full topic
item.source: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!

item.title: How To make the client .bat work on 64 bit!
item.dc:creator: @CerealKiller CerealKiller
item.description:
@CerealKiller wrote:

Hi moparscape,

today ill be telling you how to make a .bat file work on a 64 bit computer

  1. go to your client and open it up
  2. go to run.bat and right click it then click edit
  3. then were start javaw change it to “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe”
    LIKE SO
    16c14p3.png1366×768
  4. Save it and it should work for all of the client’s (well almost)

If you need a video here you go:
http://adf.ly/b18P

Read full topic
